com.rockhoppertech.music

Class Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rockhoppertech.music.Pattern

  • public class Pattern
extends Object
    Essentially a holder for the values to create a MIDITrack based on a given set of degrees and a pattern contained in an int array. The real work is done by MIDITrackFactory.getTrackPattern(int[], int[], int, int, int, double, boolean, double, boolean)
    Author:
    Gene De Lisa

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Pattern.Builder
      Bloch's pattern and not the GoF pattern.

      Pattern(Scale scale, int[] pattern) 
      Pattern(Scale scale, int[] pattern, int startPitch) 
      Pattern(Scale scale, int[] pattern, int startPitch, int numOctaves, double duration, boolean reverse, double restBetweenPatterns)
      Scale scale = ScaleFactory.getScaleByName(&quot;Major&quot;); int[] pattern = new int[] { 0, 2 }; int numOctaves = 1; double duration = Duration.Q; double restBetweenPatterns = Duration.Q; boolean reverse = false; Pattern scalePattern = new Pattern(scale, pattern, C5, numOctaves, duration, reverse, restBetweenPatterns); scalePattern.setUpAndDown(true); MIDITrack nl = scalePattern.createTrack(1d);

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(int[] degrees,

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(int[] degrees,
               int[] pattern,
               int startPitch,
               int numOctaves,
               double duration,
               boolean reverse,
               double restBetweenPatterns)
        Each entry in the pattern is an index into the degrees. So this value must be < the length of the degree array. A pattern = new int[] { 0 } is the identity result. 
         
 int[] degrees = new int[] { 0, 2, 4, 5, 6, 9, 11 };
 int[] pattern = new int[] { 0, 2 };
 int numOctaves = 1;
 double duration = Duration.Q;
 double restBetweenPatterns = Duration.Q;
 boolean reverse = false;
 Pattern nlPattern = new Pattern(degrees, pattern, C5, numOctaves, duration,
         reverse, restBetweenPatterns);
 nlPattern.setUpAndDown(true);
 MIDITrack nl = nlPattern.createTrack(1d);
        Parameters:
        degrees - the degrees
        pattern - the pattern
        startPitch - start pitch
        numOctaves - how many octaves
        duration - the duration
        reverse - should it be reversed
        restBetweenPatterns - duration between patterns

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(Scale scale,
               int[] pattern)

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(Scale scale,
               int[] pattern,
               int startPitch)

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(Scale scale,
               int[] pattern,
               int startPitch,
               int numOctaves,
               double duration,
               boolean reverse,
               double restBetweenPatterns)
         
 Scale scale = ScaleFactory.getScaleByName(&quot;Major&quot;);
 int[] pattern = new int[] { 0, 2 };
 int numOctaves = 1;
 double duration = Duration.Q;
 double restBetweenPatterns = Duration.Q;
 boolean reverse = false;
 Pattern scalePattern = new Pattern(scale, pattern, C5, numOctaves, duration,
         reverse, restBetweenPatterns);
 scalePattern.setUpAndDown(true);
 MIDITrack nl = scalePattern.createTrack(1d);
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale
        pattern - the pattern
        startPitch - the start pitch
        numOctaves - how many octaves
        duration - the duration
        reverse - reverse the pattern
        restBetweenPatterns - duration between patterns

        public MIDITrack createTrack(double gap,
                             boolean spread)
        If the pattern is based on degrees instead of midipitches then spread will project the degress over the number of octaves
        Parameters:
        gap - the gap between patterns
        spread - number of octaves
        Returns:
        a MIDITrack
